job_history.work_description: Recruited by the Board of Directors to become COO. Oversaw all aspects of this 35+ year old medical practice comprised of 5 freestanding radiation oncology clinics located in the South Puget Sound with 8 physicians (6 whom are owners) and 64 employees. Revenues grew from $48MM in 2008 to over $53MM in 2014. This was due to the addition of two offices (one in Gig Harbor and one in Olympia) as well as additional modalities of treatment. Achievements: Saved the company over $160,000 in 2015 due to hard negotiations with our Electronic Medical Record vendor due to poor performance. Saved the company over $120,000 annually by negotiating with the bank to lower interest rates on loans in early 2009. Brought two construction projects, one for a new clinic with a $6.5MM budget and the other for an extensive remodel with a $4.5MM budget, under budget and on time saving $200,000 in total. Brought in a consultant to successfully turn the Board Meetings into efficient, professional meetings with strict agendas, time allotments for each topic and rules of order. Oversaw the opening of and addition of a Urology practice as well as the first mobile Brachytherapy unit in the State of WA (for the treatment of various types of cancer). Both contributed to an increase in revenues to the company of more than $1MM annually. Successfully negotiated with two of the owners for buyouts on behalf of the Board. One was amicable and the other was contentious. This will result in cost savings to the company in excess of $1MM annually.

Recruited by and joined as Vice President and Commercial Banker with no loan portfolio. Through aggressive sales calls/marketing, grew portfolio to over $30MM in outstandings and $50MM in commitments in three years! This was accomplished with a consistent and active marketing plan aimed at targeting well known businesses in the area as well as utilizing a strong referral base consisting of lawyers, accountants and existing customers of the Bank. Promoted to SVP due to growth of portfolio and fee income/referrals. Promoted to SVP and SWWA Commercial Banking Manager. In this position, I was responsible for 8 commercial middle market lenders, whose territory stretched from Auburn to Longview, WA.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Held high-level positions such as COO and Vice President, overseeing large teams and making strategic decisions, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Successfully managed multiple construction projects, including a new clinic and an extensive remodel, bringing them under budget and on time, showing strong proficiency.

skills.name: Financial Management
skills.explanation: Negotiated with vendors and banks to save the company over $280,000 annually, and grew revenues from $48MM to over $53MM in 6 years, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Negotiation
skills.explanation: Successfully negotiated with vendors, banks, and owners to save the company money and increase revenues, showing strong proficiency.

skills.name: Strategic Planning
skills.explanation: Developed and implemented a marketing plan that grew a loan portfolio to over $30MM in outstandings and $50MM in commitments in three years, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Team Management
skills.explanation: Managed teams of up to 8 people, including commercial middle market lenders, and was responsible for their territory and performance, showing strong proficiency.

skills.name: Banking
skills.explanation: Held a position as Vice President and Commercial Banker, and was certified by the Pacific Coast Banking School, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Business Development
skills.explanation: Grew a loan portfolio through aggressive sales calls and marketing, and increased revenues through the addition of new practices and services, indicating strong proficiency.
